seriesJson.title: Your rights are on trial
seriesJson.description: Discussions and dramatizations of recent high court decisions.  Features Professors of Law Monrad Paulsen of Columbia University and Charles Alan Wright of University of Texas.

node.title: National security or individual rights
node.description: This program disusses the struggle of maintaining national security while preserving citizen's individual rights.

node.title: Avoiding self-incrimination
node.description: This program discusses "The Slochower Case"  and the right to avoid self-incrimination.

node.title: Right to impartial jury
node.description: This program, which focuses on the case "Eugene Dennis versus the United States," discusses the right to an impartial jury.

node.title: Right to counsel
node.description: This program, "The Case of the Missing Lawyers," discusses the right to counsel.

node.title: Right to face accusers
node.description: This program focuses on the right to face one's accusers. Guest is Alan Barth, author of "The Loyalty of Free Men" and  "The Case of Dr. Peters' Loyalty."

node.title: Civilian court trial
node.description: "The Case of the Korean Killing" analyzes Toth v. Quarles, the case of a veteran fighting for the right to a trial in civilian court, despite the alleged crime occurring while he was still in the military overseas.

contributor.name: National Educational Television and Radio Center

node.title: Fair Trial Versus Free Press
node.description: This program, "The Case of the Baltimore Radio Show," analyzes the balance between fair trials and the free press. Guests are Harrison L. Winter, attorney for State of Maryland; and Elisha Hanson.

subject.name: Free press and fair trial--United States.

node.title: Right to Fair Bail
node.description: This program, "The Case of the Communists' Bail," focuses on the concept of fair bail and includes Congressman Howard Smith, author of the Smith Act.

node.title: Right to Definite Charge
node.description: This program focuses on the concept of a "right to definite charge."

node.title: Legal search and seizure
node.description: This program discusses the parameters of legal search and seizure. The guest speaker is General Telford Taylor, Chief Counsel for the U.S. at the Nuremburg Trials.

node.title: Reasonable Interrogation
node.description: This program features William I. Siegel, assistant district attorney of Brooklyn, talking about "The Case of the Psychiatrist's Questions" and issues of interrogation.

contributor.name: National Educational Television and Radio Center

node.title: Wiretapping
node.description: This program, "The Case of the Wireless Wiretap," focuses on wiretapping and issues of privacy. It features attorney Gilbert Rosenthal; Patrick Murphy Malin, executive director of the American Civil Liberties Union; and Federal judge Jerome Frank.

node.title: Due process of law
node.description: This program focuses on the concept of due process of law and includes Supreme Court Justice William O. Douglas and Federal Judge Jerome Frank.
